column2:
IPMVP provides generally accepted Measurement and Verification (M&V) principles.
Particularly, M&V is a process for quantifying the actual energy savings achieved through the implementation of Energy Conservations Measures (ECMs), retrofits or load management.
column3: 1) To give standard practice for M&V.

column2:
The Itaca Protocol is a tool for assessing the level of energy and environmental sustainability of buildings by verifying the performance in reference to:
- building consumption
- energy efficiency
- impact on the environment
- impact on human health.  
                                                        The ITACA Protocol is derived from the SBTool international evaluation model, developed as part of the Green Building Challenge research process, and contextualized to the Italian territory in relation to the reference legislation and its environmental characteristics.
column3:
1) To provide a design support tool for professionals.
2) To provide a control and guidance tool for the public administration.
3) To support the choice of consumers.
4) To enhance an investment for financial operators.
column7: All building stakeholders accross all building lifecycle from design and construction stages to end users, including governance level.
column8: Reflects on building sustainability, energy efficiency and human health.
column11: Level 1: Building (residential and non residential buoldings)
column12:
Multi-criteria analysis system for assessing environmental sustainability, structured according to three hierarchical levels:

1) Areas, which represent macro-themes that are considered significant for the purposes of assessing the environmental sustainability of a building, such as:
Area A. Site quality
Area B. Consumption of resources
Area C. Environmental loads
Area D. Indoor environmental quality
Area E. Quality of service

2) Categories, each of which deals with a particular aspect of the area topic to which it belongs.

3) Criteria, each of which explores a particular aspect of the category to which they belong. Finally, the criteria represent the evaluation items of the method and are used to characterize the building's performance at the beginning of the evaluation process.
column13: The Protocol  is mandatory for interventions with public funding exceeding 50%.
